summary: Cynthia Sue Cooper was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). The documents provided are payroll and certification reports that list her name, salary, and employment dates. She appears in payroll certifications for April 1978 and August 1978, as well as a certification report for December 1978. These documents indicate that she was employed by the committee during these periods.
significance: Cynthia Sue Cooper's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. While the specific nature of her role is not detailed in these documents, her presence on the payroll indicates she contributed to the committee's work in investigating the JFK assassination.
